detaileddescription.para: macro used to represent the delay required for BMA280 after the power-up
macro used to represent the delay required for BME280 after the power-up
macro used to represent the delay required for BMG160 after the power-up
macro used to represent the delay required for BMI160 after the power-up
macro used to represent the delay required for BMM150 after the power-up
macro used to represent the delay required for MAX4409 after the power-up

briefdescription.para: Maps the GPIO pins to their desired function.

detaileddescription.para: This function once called will map the GPIO pins related to the sensor node to their desired functions.

parameterdescription.para: in the case of success or an error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Disables the control over the peripheral.

detaileddescription.para: This function once called will disable control over the requested sensor peripheral by executing the disabling procedure as prescribed in the vendor datasheet.

parameterdescription.para: identifier of the sensor targeted by the disable request. This is defined in the Board Interface under the BSP_Sensor_E enumeration.
in the case of success or an error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: This function disconnects the GPIO pins dedicated to the sensor node and put them into low power consumption status.

parameterdescription.para: in the case of success or an error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Enables the control over the peripheral.

detaileddescription.para:
A prior call to MCU_<RESOURCE>_Initialize() is necessary for this function in order to operate.This function once called will allow the required sensor peripheral to receive, execute commands and transmit process data.
id
identifier of the sensor targeted by the enable request.
callback
If the sensor has dedicated interrupt lines a callback is required to process the generated events.
RETCODE_OK
in the case of success or an error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the handle of the communication interface used by the peripheral in case I2C is used for the sensor node.

detaileddescription.para:
After successful execution of BSP_Board_Initialize(param1, param2), the application is free to call this function in order to get the handle needed by the resources drivers. This handle will be used by the MCU drivers for the intended resources I2C, SPI, UART, etc.
HWHandle_T: Handle for the used MCU resource.

briefdescription.para: Returns the boolean (TRUE/FALSE) based on the sensor node Enable/Disable status used by the peripheral in case I2C is used for the sensor node.

detaileddescription.para:
only after successful Disable of all the sensor nodes this API will return TRUE. Even if one sensor node is enabled then we get FALSE from this API
Bool: Boolean (TRUE/FALSE).

This function disables the bus if it is not in use by any sensor
Sensor
the sensor requesting to be enabled

This function enables the bus and registers the sensor in the bus shared register
Sensor
the sensor requesting to be enabled

briefdescription.para: I2C interrupt service routine used to capture events at the I2C resource and to forward them to the MCU driver for processing.
Implementation of I2C Sensor Node BSP functions.
